docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Feb 15 -- S.M. McAshan Jr., head of the United States Purchasing Commission here, confirmed today the report that he had resigned. He arrived yesterday from the United States to wind up his affairs and will return home soon,...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Feb 15 -- S.M. McAshan Jr., head of the United States Purchasing Commission here, confirmed today the report that he had resigned. He arrived yesterday from the United States to wind up his affairs and will return home soon, he said.
docs.abstract: S M McAshan, head of US Purchasing Comm which controls lend-lease agencies in Brazil, and 2 aides resign; silent on BEW; comment

headline.main: PURCHASING CHIEF QUITS BRAZIL POST; S.M. McAshan Jr., Head of U.S. Commission, Confirms Step -- 2 Aides Also Resign

docs.snippet: ALMOST on the centenary, March 1, of the issuing of the first stamps of the Cantonal Administration which preceded the Swiss Confederation, there comes to the auction market one of the finest collections of a foreign country's early stamps ever...
docs.lead_paragraph: ALMOST on the centenary, March 1, of the issuing of the first stamps of the Cantonal Administration which preceded the Swiss Confederation, there comes to the auction market one of the finest collections of a foreign country's early stamps ever publicly placed on sale in the United States.

headline.main: STAMPS: SALE OF FINE SWISS RARITIES

docs.snippet: Our Office Moralist wonders whether conscience has anything to do with the German collapse in Russia. "Now conscience wakes despair," he quotes, and, "Conscience does make cowards of us all," and again, "My conscience hath a thousand several tongues,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Our Office Moralist wonders whether conscience has anything to do with the German collapse in Russia. "Now conscience wakes despair," he quotes, and, "Conscience does make cowards of us all," and again, "My conscience hath a thousand several tongues, and every tongue brings in a several tale, and every tale condemns me for a villain."

docs.snippet: Seven prominent newspaper men from Montevideo, Uruguay, and two from Lima, Peru, arrived in New York yesterday after a tour through the Southern States, the West Coast and the Northern industrial centers.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb.22 -- Agreements similar to that worked out with Brazil regarding that country's imports from the United States have been concluded with ten other Latin-American countries, it was learned at the Board of Economic Warfare today.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb.22 -- Agreements similar to that worked out with Brazil regarding that country's imports from the United States have been concluded with ten other Latin-American countries, it was learned at the Board of Economic Warfare today.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 22 (U.P.) -- Hundreds of United States factories now devoted to the war effort will be dismantled and moved to Latin-American countries when the war ends, Eric Johnston, president of the Chamber of Commerce of the United...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 22 (U.P.) -- Hundreds of United States factories now devoted to the war effort will be dismantled and moved to Latin-American countries when the war ends, Eric Johnston, president of the Chamber of Commerce of the United States, said today in an interview.
docs.abstract: in Montevideo, repts plan to dismantle US war plants after war and move them to Latin Amer

headline.main: LATIN AMERICA TO GET OUR OLD WAR PLANTS; Johnston of U.S. Chamber Says We Will Grant Credits

docs.snippet: Declaring that the American people wished the press to have freedom to "tell the truth about the war, no matter how unpleasant it may be," Frederick E. Hasler, president of the Pan American Society, suggested yesterday that "sugar-coated war news"...
docs.lead_paragraph: Declaring that the American people wished the press to have freedom to "tell the truth about the war, no matter how unpleasant it may be," Frederick E. Hasler, president of the Pan American Society, suggested yesterday that "sugar-coated war news" encouraged absentees at war plants, thereby slowing up work on the home front.

headline.main: WAR PLANT SLUMPS LAID TO CENSORSHIP; Hasler, Pan American Official, Says 'Sugar-Coated' News Leads to Absenteeism LATIN JOURNALISTS FETED Visitors From South America Are Told We Will Win the Conflict at Any Cost
